p: The robust fragrance scent of A. nilagirica, A. vulgaris, and their species are principally due to the immense amount of volatile terpene and its active components of the essential oil (Abad et al. 2012). The chemical ingredients of A. vulgaris include flavonoids, coumarins, volatile oils, sesquiterpene, lactones, inulin, and traces of alkaloids. The major components of essential oils are camphene, 1,8 cineole, α-thujone, germacrene D, β caryophyllene, and camphor (Jerkovic et al. 2003) are given in Table 2, and extraction of mugwort oil is represented in Table 3.
